title: Business & Finance
text:
The ECB said it would phase out its large bond-buying program sooner than expected and paved the way for interest-rate increases later this year.

---

U.S. stocks declined, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 0.4%, 0.95% and 0.3%, respectively. Oil prices fell, reversing early gains.

---

MLB team owners and the players' union agreed to a new labor contract, ending a lockout in time to restore a full season in 2022.

---

JPMorgan said it was actively unwinding its Russian business and Goldman Sachs said it was planning an exit from Russia.

---

London's nickel market will stay closed at least until next week, giving the LME more time to resolve a crisis caused by a huge loss-making trade originating in China.

---

Peloton's new CEO is looking to overhaul the stationary-bike maker's pricing strategy in a bid to turn around the company.

---

Rivian's losses deepened in the fourth quarter and the firm said supply-chain challenges would sharply curtail its factory output this year.

---

BNY Mellon named Vice Chair Robin Vince to be its new CEO, succeeding Todd Gibbons, who plans to retire.
